newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to issue T-bills on August 27.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to issue T-bills on August 27.

text.p: Ukraine's central bank will auction three-month, six-month, nine-month and 12-month discount treasury bills on August 27, the head of the bank's capital markets and exchange department, Vitaly Migashko, told Reuters.
The central bank is not setting the issue volume in advance. It last auctioned three-month treasury bills on August 22 and six- and nine-month bills on August 20.
At the three-month T-bill auction, the bank sold 1.153 trillion karbovanets worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 57.30 percent. The average price was 8.750 million karbovanets.
On August 20, a sale of 79.37 billion karbovanets worth of paper averaged a yield of 59.90 percent. The average price was 7.700 million karbovanets.
The 770 million karbovanets worth of nine-month paper sold at an average yield of 59.90 percent.
On August 6, the 6.206 trillion karbovanets worth of 12-month discount T-bills sold with an average yield of 55.19 percent. The average price was 6.450 million karbovanets.
